title: 2008년 Alghazouli 사건
summary: 미국 USA, Federal 법원 판결 사건. 사건명: Alghazouli. 판결일: 2008-03-04. 법원: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit.
description:
## 사건 정보

**사건명**: UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. Amar ALGHAZOULI, Defendant-Appellant
**판결일**: 2008-03-04
**법원**: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
**관할**: USA, Federal

**판사**: Barry G. Silverman, W. Fletcher, and Richard R. Clifton, Circuit Judges

## 변호인

Amar Alghazouli, pro se, Taft, CA, Benjamin L. Coleman, San Diego, CA, for the appellant., Melanie K. Pierson, Roger W. Haines, Jr., Office of the U.S. Attorney, San Diego, CA, for the appellee.

## 인용

- 517 F.3d 1179

## 판결문 요약


517 F.3d 1179 (2008)
UNITED STATES of America, Plaintiff-Appellee,
v.
Amar ALGHAZOULI, Defendant-Appellant.
No. 06-50422.
United States Court of Appeals, Ninth Circuit.
Argued and Submitted July 11, 2007.
Filed March 4, 2008.
*1180 *1181 Amar Alghazouli, pro se, Taft, CA, Benjamin L. Coleman, San Diego, CA, for the appellant.
Melanie K. Pierson, Roger W. Haines, Jr., Office of the U.S. Attorney, San Diego, CA, for the appellee.
Before: BARRY G. SILVERMAN, W. FLETCHER, and RICHARD R. CLIFTON, Circuit Judges.

OPINION
WILLIAM A. FLETCHER, Circuit Judge:
Appellant Amar Alghazouli ("Alghazouli") was convicted by a jury on five counts arising out of unlawful importation of R-12 freon, an ozone-depleting substance. *1182 Three counts (Counts 1, 2, and 6) charged Alghazouli with violating 18 U.S.C. § 545. Section 545 prohibits fraudulent or knowing importation of merchandise "contrary to law," as well as the receipt, concealment, or sale of merchandise, or the facilitation of the transportation, concealment, or sale of merchandise, which the defendant knows to have been imported "contrary to law." The fourth count (Count 8) charged Alghazouli with conspiring to violate two money laundering statutes in violation of 18 U.S.C. § 1956(h). That count also charged, as a predicate offense for the money laundering offenses, a violation of 18 U.S.C. § 545. The fifth count (Count 15) charged Alghazouli with violating 42 U.S.C. § 7413(c)(1), based on his having knowingly violated a regulation...
